page.title: 15Landscape and Buildings.
page.content: Almost surrounded by the factory buildings of British Cellophane Ltd. is Sydenham Manor, known as {Sideba } at the time of the Norman conquest and referred to as such in the original Domesday Book. It is a 'listed building' and must therefore be well_maintained. The authority on historical architecture N.Pevsner describes it as "a picturesque and many_gabled 16th century house with an early 17th century range set in front of it". It is further described as Gothic rather than Renaissance and early Tudor rather than Elizabethan. It is estimated that it was built in 1500 and has had a varied career. Currently it is used as a dining room by the company directors.Its stone contrasts with the utilitarian brck of the factory.
